Resistance from stakeholders: There may be resistance from various stakeholders, such as interest groups, businesses, or citizens, who may not support the new policy or may have vested interests in its failure.
Lack of public awareness: The new policy may not be well-known or understood by the public, leading to confusion or misunderstandings.
Inadequate planning: The government may not have thoroughly planned the implementation of the new policy, leading to unforeseen challenges or difficulties.
Political opposition: The new policy may face opposition from political parties or factions, making it difficult to pass or implement.
Technical difficulties: There may be technical issues with the implementation of the new policy, such as software glitches or hardware failures.
